subsc: General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector,Health
sectr: Agriculture, fishing, and forestry,Health and other social services

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objectives of the Nepal
            Avian Influenza Control Project are to minimize the threat
            posed by highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) to humans
            in Nepal by controlling such infections among birds,
            especially domestic poultry, and preparing for, controlling,
            and responding to possible human infections, especially an
            influenza epidemic and related emergencies. The project
            components include: animal health - this component will
            support national prevention and control strategies; human
            health - this component aims to prevent a human influenza
            epidemic caused by HPAI, project management - this component
            will support the strengthening of public agencies for the
            coordination and management of the Project; and
            communication - this programme is cross-cutting and
            underpins both the animal health and human health components
            of the project.
